rComments: Gave a lot of reading for EDU 180. However, most of it was solid. Midterm was not as bad as study guide made it seem, final wasn't too bad either. It took some work but if you're serious about the minor and passionate about education, this class will be informative and open your eyes about a lot of issues. See him in office hours for reading recs!

Very interesting class about media but the prof. is a tough grader. There is not enough time to take the midterm. The 6+ questions had mini questions included with it so that didn't help. Overall, I did learn a lot but the length of the final paper is way too long to finish within a week or so.

Brad is hands-down awesome! I don't know what the previous commenter is talking about--he VALUES students' participation and opinions, and always encourages discussions. Readings were interesting, topic engaging, and Brad really made the class interested in the material. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, he's one of the best!

VERY HEAVY, BORING reading. Insults quicker students. Gives pop quizzes! Misuses terms and concepts from other fields and expects you to use these mistruths in tests/papers. Class material is pretty interesting of itself; grading based mostly on one (extremely long) written midterm, three five-page "memos," and one 12 - 14 pg paper.

One of the best classes and best teachers I've had at UCSC.  Inspiring, passionate, committed, and dedicated to change!  I learned so much and engaged at a very high level with the content and teaching of this course.  HIGHLY recommended! Can't wait to take another class with Brad.

Critical Pedagogy is such an important class to take for all who want to become teachers one day. The class is discussion based and everyone is encouraged to speak up. However, Brad has students take quizes on the reading which are very specific on the material. There are three 4 page essays, and a 16-20 page final. Teachers towards the student.

I was probably one of the few people who did not like this class. I thought that Brad was overly political about the course and was pompous at times. The only thing that made the course worthwhile was the TA Carrie (she's amazing!).

Learned a lot about media and education.  Brad really knows a lot, and is good at helping others get it.  He's really helpful in office hours.  Helps you become critical about the media.  I really like the class and the material, it was really engaging.

this was his second class ever taught i believe. awesome teacher. introduced some interesting topics and had some very interesting discussions. very liberal grading system. too many short papers for such a short period of time. almost one a week-due at the end. a group presentation and final paper. easy class.
